placeDesc: Jungle Gardens is a 170 acre self-guided swamp and garden tour located next to the Tabasco factory on Avery Island.Â  It features a 900-year-old Buddha statue, a snowy white egret habitat called Bird City, and plenty of other local wildlife and exotic botanical specimens from around the world.Founded by Edward McIlhenny, Jungle Gardens was created originally as a private bird sanctuary on his estate. In 1935 McIlhenny opened it to the public.
placeShortDesc: A swamp and garden tour featuring local wildlife and exotic botanical specimens from around the world.
placeNearby: Tabasco Museum and Factory,Lake Peigneur,Wrong Way Cemetery
placeAddress: 5215 Avery Island Rd,New Iberia, Louisiana,United States
placeRelatedPlaces: Jardin du Tripot,Delta Sensory Gardens,Asticou Azalea Garden,Okochi Sanso Gardens
